thread.title: On the Amalfi Coast, Music of Sinatra and Chopin - The New York Times
thread.title_full: On the Amalfi Coast, Music of Sinatra and Chopin - The New York Times

author: Masha Goncharova
title: On the Amalfi Coast, Music of Sinatra and Chopin - The New York Times
text:
Continue reading the main story Share This Page Continue reading the main story Continue reading the main story If it weren’t heavenly enough to hike the winding Paths of the Gods trails that float 1,640 feet above the Amalfi Coast, the city of Praiano’s Town Hall and the Pelagos Tourist Office of Praiano organize a free, open-air concert series of classical and jazz music in May, September and October.
Placing musicians along the coastline for morning concerts since 2005, I Suoni degli Dei is held on the mystical backdrop of historic cliffs and views of the nearby islands, where Homer’s Odysseus is said to have succumbed to the temptations of the beautiful Sirens.
Numerous paths lead to the peaks of Monti Lattari, the church of Santa Maria a Castro and the Sentiero degli Dei, a natural theater suspended above the Punta Campanella and the Isle of Capri.
Performances begin at 10:45 in the morning, meaning a wake-up call of about 9 a.m. to make the hour-and-a-half hike from Praiano, Agerola or Positano.
